com.ctb.tdc.bootstrap.processwrapper
Class JettyProcessWrapper

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      com.ctb.tdc.bootstrap.processwrapper.JettyProcessWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class JettyProcessWrapper
extends java.lang.Thread

Wrapper class for starting the Jetty process. There are two main commands to be executed for controlling Jetty, the start command and the stop command. Normal starting of this thread uses the start command. Exiting this thread requires the invocation of the shutdown() method which will call the stop command to shutdown the wrapped Jetty process.

Author:
Giuseppe_Gennaro

Constructor Detail

JettyProcessWrapper

public JettyProcessWrapper(java.lang.String tdcHome)
                    throws com.ctb.tdc.bootstrap.processwrapper.exception.ProcessWrapperException
Creates a new Jetty process wrapper with the given tdcHome value.

Parameters:
tdcHome - The location of the Test Delivery Client's home folder containing the home folder of Jetty as well as configuration files and additional java libraries.
Throws:
com.ctb.tdc.bootstrap.processwrapper.exception.ProcessWrapperException - If problems within initialization such as determing the default URL or if the port is already in use.
Method Detail

isAvailable

public boolean isAvailable()
Returns whether the Jetty process is currently available. The internal flag is managed by detecting when the process is actually running and capable of serving HTTP requests.

Returns:
true if Jetty is up and able to server HTTP requests, false otherwise.

getExitCode

public int getExitCode()
Returns:
0 if there were no errors, -1 otherwise.

getExitMessage

public java.lang.String getExitMessage()
Returns:
empty string if there were no messages, error message otherwise.

run

public void run()
Starts Jetty with an external system process. Will attempt to connect to the default page served by Jetty to determine if it is available. If it is available, this thread will block and wait for the Jetty process to exit. The Jetty process will exit when this method's shutdown() is called to stop Jetty.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Stops Jetty by executing the system specific stop command.
